snippet: The pension fund’s board voted to get rid of holdings from five gun companies, making the fund the biggest in the country so far to shed such holdings.
abstract: New York City teachers’ pension fund votes to shed its portfolio of five gun companies, despite objections of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg; divestiture, which follows outcry that has intensified since school shootings in Newtown, Conn, makes fund largest in nation, with $46.6 billion in holdings, to divest gun holdings.
lead_paragraph: The pension fund’s board voted to get rid of holdings from five gun companies, making the fund the biggest in the country so far to shed such holdings.

headline.seo: New York City Teachers’ Pension Fund Gets Rid of Gun Holdings
headline.main: Teachers’ Pension Fund Divests Gun Holdings
headline.print_headline: Teachers’ Pension Fund Divests Gun Holdings
